etymologies: modern Latin, from Greek korudallis ‘crested lark’, alluding to a similarity between the flower and the bird's spur

definitions: a herbaceous plant of the poppy family with spurred tubular flowers, closely related to bleeding heart and found in north temperate regions.

notes.text: Genus Corydalis, family Fumariaceae: many species, including yellow corydalis (C. flavula) of the eastern US

shortDefinitions: herbaceous plant with spurred tubular flowers
